segments.pli: Saṃyutta Nikāya 17
4. Catutthavagga
35. Acirapakkantasutta
Ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā rājagahe viharati gijjhakūṭe pabbate acirapakkante devadatte.
segments.en: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha, on the Vulture’s Peak Mountain, not long after Devadatta had left.

segments.pli: Tatra kho bhagavā devadattaṃ ārabbha bhikkhū āmantesi:
segments.en: There the Buddha spoke to the mendicants about Devadatta:

segments.pli: “attavadhāya, bhikkhave, devadattassa lābhasakkārasiloko udapādi, parābhavāya devadattassa lābhasakkārasiloko udapādi.
segments.en: “Possessions, honor, and popularity came to Devadatta for his own ruin and downfall.

segments.pli: Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, kadalī attavadhāya phalaṃ deti, parābhavāya phalaṃ deti;
evameva kho, bhikkhave, attavadhāya devadattassa lābhasakkārasiloko udapādi, parābhavāya devadattassa lābhasakkārasiloko udapādi.
Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, veḷu attavadhāya phalaṃ deti, parābhavāya phalaṃ deti;
evameva kho, bhikkhave, attavadhāya devadattassa lābhasakkārasiloko udapādi, parābhavāya devadattassa lābhasakkārasiloko udapādi.
Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, naḷo attavadhāya phalaṃ deti, parābhavāya phalaṃ deti;
segments.en: or a reed, all of which bear fruit to their own ruin and downfall …

segments.pli: evameva kho, bhikkhave, attavadhāya devadattassa lābhasakkārasiloko udapādi, parābhavāya devadattassa lābhasakkārasiloko udapādi.
Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, assatarī attavadhāya gabbhaṃ gaṇhāti, parābhavāya gabbhaṃ gaṇhāti;
segments.en: It’s like a mule, which becomes pregnant to its own ruin and downfall.

segments.pli: evameva kho, bhikkhave, attavadhāya devadattassa lābhasakkārasiloko udapādi, parābhavāya devadattassa lābhasakkārasiloko udapādi.
segments.en: In the same way, possessions, honor, and popularity came to Devadatta for his own ruin and downfall.

segments.pli: Evaṃ dāruṇo kho, bhikkhave, lābhasakkārasiloko.
segments.en: So brutal are possessions, honor, and popularity. …”

segments.pli: Evañhi vo, bhikkhave, sikkhitabban”ti.
Idamavoca bhagavā.
segments.en: That is what the Buddha said.

segments.pli: Idaṃ vatvāna sugato athāparaṃ etadavoca satthā:
segments.en: Then the Holy One, the Teacher, went on to say:

segments.pli: “Phalaṃ ve kadaliṃ hanti,
segments.en: “The banana tree is destroyed by its own fruit,

segments.pli: phalaṃ veḷuṃ phalaṃ naḷaṃ;
segments.en: as are the bamboo and the reed.

segments.pli: Sakkāro kāpurisaṃ hanti,
gabbho assatariṃ yathā”ti.
Pañcamaṃ.

sections.title: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha,…

suttaplex.blurb: Material possessions, honor, and praise led to Devadatta’s downfall, like the fruit of a plantain.
